radiographic_examinations.findings: The tip of the endotracheal tube is approximately 1.5 cm above the carina; there is diffuse consolidation in the right lung, most prominently in the right upper lobe. The left lung is clear.
radiographic_examinations.changes_over_time: A follow-up radiograph obtained 24 hours later showed rapid clearing of the consolidation in the right lung.

radiographic_examinations.findings: Dysfunction and enlargement of the right ventricle with moderate tricuspid insufficiency. The left ventricle appears to function normally.
radiographic_examinations.changes_over_time: A follow-up echocardiogram performed 10 days after the first admission showed improvement in right ventricular size and function.

radiographic_examinations.findings: Small left frontal and cerebellar hemorrhages.

radiographic_examinations.procedure_name: Ultrasound of the femoral and popliteal veins
CT scan of the abdomen and pelvis
radiographic_examinations.findings: A clot that filled the inferior vena cava and extended to the left common iliac vein.
